intro: Monticalia reissiana, commonly known as the Reiss's monticalia, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists alike.
